get.summary: Get this Document
Check existence of a user in the system
get.description: /! DEPRECATED: 410 GoneError

post.summary: Creates a user account.

put.summary: Updates user information
put.description: Updates the information for callingUser with the information provided.  Can be used to update password, phone number, email address, first name, last name, or username.  If username, email, or phone number already exist in the system, an error will be returned.  Returns an authorization error if no session key is provided or if session has expired.

get.summary: check email or phone for duplicates
get.description: it will return true or false to check if user is register and return detail msg after exists == false. request query are optional between email and phone, but will return 4xx err_code if query body is not one of these

schema.description: [optional] string: user phone number,standard format is E164

get.summary: Get information on a user
get.description:
`/users/me` will return information for calling (OAuth'd) user,whereas `/users/:userID` will return the information for the user specified by `:userID`.  Returns _Not Found_ if userID does not exist.

* `locks` is a hash of `{lockID: "User type (superuser|manager|user)"}`
* `houses` is a hash of `{houseID: "User type (superuser|manager|user)}`
"

UserName.description: <user name to log in to web page, etc.>

get.summary: Get a list of calling user's houses.
get.description: At least a house name is required.  The only error from this function is Bad Request when no house name is provided.

get.summary: Get information about an existing house
get.description: users is a hash of {userID: usertype (superuser|manager|user)}

users.description: key is userid, type - type of user

delete.summary: removes a house
delete.description: Returns 412 if the house still has locks

put.summary: update a house
put.description: returns 404 if house not found, 403 if callingUser is not owner of house

get.summary: Get list of calling user's locks
get.description: Returns an empty body if the calling user has no locks

HouseID.description: ID of house to which lock belongs

HouseName.description: Name of house to which lock belongs

HouseID.description: ID of house to which lock belongs

HouseName.description: Name of house to which lock belongs

get.summary: Get list of calling user's doorbells
get.description: Returns an empty body if the calling user has no locks

get.summary: Get list of calling user's bridges
get.description: Returns an empty body if the calling user has no bridges

get.summary: Get information about an existing lock
get.description: Returns `resource not found` if lockID does not exist and `not authorized` if the user is not a user of the lock.

HouseID.description: id of house to which lock belongs

schedule.description: Rule schedule in iCalendar data format (RFC 5545)

homeKitUniqueIdentifier.description: id of homeKit to which lock belongs to

put.summary: Update a lock's information
put.description: Currently only Lock Name, their Calibration status, and their homeKit ID can be updated

Calibrated.description: boolean. set to true if it's calibrated

homeKitUniqueIdentifier.description: id of homeKit that's specific to the lock

delete.summary: deletes a lock from the system (factory reset)
delete.description:
Removes lock from all associations in the system.
###Responses:
Code | Reason 
---- | ------
 403 | callingUser is not authorized to use lock
 404 | lock not found

put.summary: Give a user access to a lock
put.description: The only response to this function is a status code.  Returns Bad Request if lock does not exist, otherUser does not exist, or type is invalid.  Valid typs are "user" and "manager".  Returns Unauthorized if calling user is not a manager or superuser of lock

Name.description: string containing name of person to be granted access to lock

put.summary: operate a lock remotely through a bridge, if present
put.description:
###Commands:
Valid commands are `lock`, `unlock`, `status`, `reboot`, `telemetry`, and `unlatch`.

If the calling user is not authorized to use the lock a this time, it returns Unauthorized.

###Call Types:
This endpoint accepts a query string parameter "type". 
Valid types are either "sync" or "async". If type is not provided the default is sync
An async request will return immediately and return the operation's result using a communications channel defined in the request's payload
###Return values:
Status | message
------ | -------
 200 | resultObject
 202 | accepted if the request asked for async processing
 423 | "lock in use" if there is already a pending remote operation
 500 | _errorMessage varies_ if there was an error communicating with the lock (check the message returned)
 501 | "not implemented", if the command is not valid

status.description: the status of the lock at the end of the operation. One of: kAugLockState_Locked, kAugLockState_unlockedkAugLockState_Locked, kAugLockState_UnknownStaticPosition

doorState.description: the door state status of the lockOne of: kAugDoorState_Init, kAugDoorState_Closed, kAugDoorState_Ajar, kAugDoorState_Open, kAugDoorState_Unknown

startTime.description: when the request was received by the remote bridge server

duration.description: the duration in second of the full transaction between the remote bridge server and the bridge

delete.summary: cancel a previous remote operation of a lock through a bridge
delete.description: If the calling user is not authorized to use the lock a this time, it returns Unauthorized.

put.summary: Allows a client to trigger remote sync process of PINs to a lock
put.description:
return status codes: 

Status | Meaning
------ | -------
 200 | Ok, but nothing to do. 
 202 | Synchronization will start soon. 
 409 | No bridge associated or the bridge is offline.

put.summary: Sets otherUsers's type on lock specified by lockID managed by calling user.
put.description: This sets otherUser's user type to type for lock lockID. This can only be done if the calling user is a superuser of the lock. If other user is an invitee the invitation is updated. Returns Unauthorized if calling user is not the superuser of the lock. Returns Not Found if lockID or otherUserID do not exist or there is no corresponding invitation for other user. Returns Bad Request if type is not valid

delete.summary: Deletes user specified by userID from lock specified by lockID
delete.description: Returns Unauthorized if the calling user is not able to manage the lock.  Returns Not Found if lock or otherUser do not exist.

get.description: returns 200 if date range and lockID can be satisfied.  404 otherwise.

callingUser.description: User information for calling user (See GET /users/:userID)

otherUser.description: user informmation for the operand of a GRANT/DENY action (See GET /users/:userID)

get.summary: Gets 100 most recent activities across all lock I can use.
get.description: Limit of 100 entries returned. Returns activity on locks callingUser managers or superuses. Returns only callingUsers's activity on locks where he is a user.

get.summary: Gets last `:count` log entries for `:lockID` after `:dateTime` (ms since epoch)
get.description: dateTime is in ms since epoch, so unix time must be multiplied by 1000 to get the correct value

get.summary: Gets last :count log entries for :lockID before :dateTime (ms since epoch)
get.description: dateTime is in ms since epoch, so unix time must be multiplied by 1000 to get the correct value

callingUser.description: User information for calling user (See GET /users/:userID)

post.summary: Create a usage rule for a lock, which can be applied to a user
post.description: This API creates a rule which, when applied to a user, allows the user to operate the lock in the specified time frame.  Recurrence is specified as an iCalendar RFC RRULE string.

startTime.description: First time when usage window opens (ISO 8601 format)

endTime.description: First time when usage window closes (ISO 8601 format)

post.summary: Create a usage rule for a lock, and apply it to the user specified by otherUserID
post.description: This API creates a rule which, when applied to a user, allows the user to operate the lock in the specified time frame.  Recurrence is specified as an iCalendar RFC RRULE string.

startTime.description: First time when usage window opens  (ISO 8601 format)

endTime.description: First time when usage window closes  (ISO 8601 format)

schedule.description: Rule schedule in iCalender data format (RFC 5545)

Name.description: string containing name of person to be granted access to lock

put.summary: Apply a rule to a user of a lock
put.description: Restricts user specified by otherUserID's access to to the lock specified in ruleID to the time specified in ruleID.  If user specified by otherUserID does not currently have access to the lock, access is granted for the time specified by ruleID.  If user specified by otherUserID currently has unrestricted access to the lock specified in ruleID, an error is returned. If the user currently has restricted access to to the lock specified by ruleID, his access is expanded to include the time specified by ruleID.  If the user specified by otherUserID is a manager or superuser of the lock, an error is returned.

delete.summary: Removes the user specified by otherUserID from rule specified by ruleID
delete.description: returns an error if rule does not exist

get.summary: Get a list of rules for a lock
get.description: returns all relevant information about a lock rule

get.summary: Get a map of sounds by users
get.description: returns only the users who have a sound package id

get.summary: Returns list of sound packages available on lock for a known firmware version of the lock
get.description: Returns list of sound packages available on lock for a known firmware version of the lock

lockSoundURL.description: URL for sound file in a format playable on the iPhone and Android, hosted somewhere

unlockSoundURL.description: URL for sound file in a format playable on the iPhone and Android, hosted somewhere

delete.description: returns an error if rule does not exist

get.summary: return the data associated with a bridge, including the lockIds

lockIds.description: an array of locks to be associated with the bridge

appID.description: the client used to create the bridge

firmwareVersion.description: the version reported by the bridge - this may or may not be provided for all manufacturers.

delete.summary: delete a bridge lock association

post.summary: Sets up the notification hook for the lock specified by lockID.
post.description:
###notificationTypes
A JSON array containing one or more of: 

notificationType | Meaning
---------------- | -------
operation | notification of lock usage
systemstatus | notification of change in connectivity of remote bridge to service
battery | notification of battery status requiring lock owner's attention
accessmgmt | notification of change in access to the lock by any user
configuration | notification of change in lock configuration including but not limited to lock name and addition/removal of bridge.

###Responses:
Code | Reason 
---- | ------
 200 | body = {"message": "OK"} call succeeded
 401 | authorization token is not valid.
 403 | * the user represented by the authorization token is not an owner of the lock
     | * the Client ID does not have permission to subscribe to notifications on behalf of the user
     | * or the x-august-api-key header is not valid.
 404 | the clientID is not known to the system.

url.description: URL the August access control system will hit with notifications

token.description: Token August access control system will present for authentication

clientID.description: Client ID of third-party service provided by August

notificationTypes.description: Array of notification types. See Notes.

delete.summary: Deletes a webhook for an external service
delete.description: Deletes the webhook connection between an external service and lockID/callingUserID

A JSON array containing one or more of: 

notificationType | Meaning

###Responses:
Code | Reason 
---- | ------
 200 | body = {"message": "OK"} call succeeded
 401 | authorization token is not valid.
 403 | * the user represented by the authorization token is not an owner of the doorbell
     | * the Client ID does not have permission to subscribe to notifications on behalf of the user
     | * or the x-august-api-key header is not valid.
 404 | the clientID is not known to the system.

url.description: URL the August access control system will hit with notifications

token.description: Token August access control system will present for authentication

clientID.description: Client ID of third-party service provided by August

notificationTypes.description: Array of notification types. See Notes.

put.summary: Returns the status of a lock from the locks collection.
put.description: Possible values 'locked,' 'unlocked,' 'unknown,' 'not-advertising.'

isLockStatusChanged.description: boolean: whether or not status changed during previous update

get.summary: return the data associated with an associated keypad
get.description: Calling user must be a lock super user.

serialNumber.description: the serial number of the keypad

lockID.description: the lock it is associated with

firmwareVersion.description: the version reported by the keypad

delete.summary: deletes a keypad lock association and moves the its offline key to deleted
delete.description: Calling user must be a lock super user.

get.summary: Get all pins for a given lock.
get.description: Created, loaded, deleting, disabling, disabled, and enabled can all contain pin like objects.

post.summary: Load, delete, disable and enable PINs for users on a lock. Newer locks can support schedules on PINs.
post.description: See [Remote PIN Management](https://partners.august.com/userguide/apiguide/remote-pin-management-for-the-august-keypad/)

augustUserID.description: string: either a phone number identifier, email identifier or an August internal user ID

partnerUserID.description: string: an user id which will be used to report upon completion of each pin command

firstName.description: the firstName of the user, optional

lastName.description: the lastName of the user, optional

pin.description: string: a valid pin, ideally obtained in previous step to avoid failures

accessType.description: string: the type of the pin: always, recurring, temporary, oneTime

accessTimes.description: string: this field only required for access types recurring & temporary; for recurring access type possible values are "STARTSEC=<sec from start of day>[;ENDSEC=<sec from start of day>]"; if timezone of lock is known this is also valid: "DTSTART=<ISO date in UTC>[;DTEND=<ISO date in UTC>]" (end date optional, if not provided is set to 1 hour from start date). For temporary times can be ISO date strings (DTSTART/DTEND) or epoch values, e.g. "STARTSEC=<epoch value>;[;ENDSEC=<epoch value>]." Not required when schedule is provided.

accessRecurrence.description: string: only required for access type recurring. See recurrence rules under RFC2445, e.g.: "FREQ=MONTHLY;BYMONTHDAY=10,15;COUNT=20". Not required when schedule is provided.

schedule.description: string: iCal data format following RFC5545 (https://tools.ietf.org/html/rfc5545) required for access types recurring & temporary; when accessTimes & accessRecurrence are provided, data of schedule overrides their values.

retry.description: boolean: indicates whether the command should be re-tried in case of failure, optional

get.summary: generates an available random pin and reserve it for an system specified time
get.description: if there is no pin slot left (208 at the last count) it will return 409 (ConflictError)

get.summary: generates an available random pin & slot number and reserve it for a system specified time
get.description:
if there is no pin slot left (208 at the last count) it will return 409 (ConflictError)
this endpoint is going to replace 'GET /locks/:lockID/pin'
the three different type of lock credentials will not share the same slots'
type param is required in query

get.summary: query credentials in various states with a lock
get.description: created: means that the CREDENTIAL should be loaded onto the lock, first step of associating a CREDENTIAL loaded: means that the CREDENTIAL has been loaded to the lock, second and final step of associating a CREDENTIAL deleting: means that the CREDENTIAL should be deleted, first step of removing a CREDENTIAL from a lock deleted: means that the CREDENTIAL has been be deleted from the lock disabling: means the the CREDENTIAL should be disabled disabled: means that the CREDENTIAL has been marked as disabled on the lock enabling: means that the CREDENTIAL should be enabled enabled: means that the CREDENTIAL has been enabled, which means that it is back in the loaed group of CREDENTIALS. if 'type' is optional, the endpoint will query all credentials from the lock, otherwise it will return the unique type of lock credentialsif the callingUser is a lock manager, it will return all the credentials from the lock, otherwise it only return his locks' credentials

created.description: array of the unique lock & user which state is created

loaded.description: array of the unique lock & user which state is loaded

disabled.description: array of the unique lock & user which state is disabled

disabling.description: array of the unique lock & user which state is disabling

enabling.description: array of the unique lock & user which state is enabling

deleting.description: array of the unique lock & user which state is deleting

updating.description: array of the unique lock & user which state is updating

delete.summary: This deletes all pins/slots associated with a lock by type.
delete.description: this is a replacement/update for 'DEL /locks/:lockID/pins'

get.description: camera data includes manufacturer's information if camera is not from August

get.summary: This gets all the logs for a given house, allows to provide a `limit` query string

Status Codes:

404 doorbellID does not exist or a NotAuthorizedError if user is not a user of the doorbell

schema.description: <boolean> whether or not to tcp wakeup device

currentFirmwareVersion.description: <string> empty string or the current firmware version

expectedFirmwareVersion.description: <string> empty string or expected firmware version

activeTcpWakeupConnection.description: <boolean>, always false for D1 and D2

internalStatus.description: <string> status used for tcp wakeup,  /online|offline|standby|wakingup|goingToSleep/ OR emptyString

hasActivePubsubConnection.description: <boolean> internal status used for tcp wakeup response

tcpWakeupStatusCode.description: <number> status code of tcp wakeup /200|202|412/, 0 if no tcp wakeup was requested in query parameters

put.description: When a mobile device detects the clock on the lock is out of sync, it sets the time and informs the server of the adjustment.  Returns authorization error if callingUser is not able to use lock.  Returns success otherwise.

put.description: alias for PUT /locks/timeadjustment/:lockID/:realtime/:locktime (no j in timeadjustment)

post.description: sends push notification to callingUser (phone or dashboard) when otherUser uses lock.  Values for 'on':  lock - notifies on lock, unlock - notifies on unlock, both - notifies on both, neither disables notifications when otherUser uses lock

Date format is YYYYMMDDHHMMSSmmm.  If action is lockdata or lockcommand, body must contain data from the lock

put.summary: takes two random numbers then returns a packet to be sent to the lock and a URL to PUT the response
put.description: The mobile device PUTs mRand1 and mRand2 to the endpoint and then sends the packet in the response to the lock. When the lock responds, the response is send to the url specified by URL using the method specified by method.  Returns an Invalid Argument error if checksum fails.

packet.description: hex-encoded stream to send to lock

url.description: URL to which the response must be delivered using the method specified in the method key

method.description: method to use to deliver the response from the lock.

put.summary: Generates random numbers then returns a packet to be sent to the lock and a URL to PUT the response
put.description: The mobile device PUTs mRand1 and mRand2 to the endpoint and then sends the packet in the response to the lock. When the lock responds, the response is send to the url specified by URL using the method specified by method.  Returns an Invalid Argument error if checksum fails.

packet.description: hex-encoded stream to send to lock

url.description: URL to which the response must be delivered using the method specified in the method key

method.description: method to use to deliver the response from the lock.

put.summary: takes the lock's response to the exchange key packet and returns lRand1 and lRand2
put.description: The mobile device PUTs the response from the exchange key command to this endpiont.  The service returns lRand1 and lRand2 for use in the session key

LockResponse.description: hex-encoded response that lock returned from exchange keys command

lRand1.description: lRand1 for use in session key

lRand2.description: lRand2 for use in session key

get.summary: returns the URL to which to connect for real-time updates

get.summary: returns the Nest structures for the user if they have associated their August ID with their Nest ID
get.description: There can be more than one structure ID in the response object (which is an Object, not an Array).

get.summary: Get enabled optional features for platform/version/callingUserID

put.summary: Put information about the calling user's choices on setting geofence for automatic unlock foir the given lockID and platform (iOS or Android)

movedCenter.description: boolean -- indicates the user moved the center of the geofence (required)

changedRadius.description: boolean -- indicates the user changed the radius from the default value (required)

newRadius.description: radius the user set if they changed it (Required if changedRadius is true)

get.summary: Check if there are any ARM updates available and return a new firmware blob if there is a new version available
get.description: As of August 2015, this endpoint is deprecated, since it does not support TI firmware updates. All new code should use the endpoint GET /locks/:lockID/firmware/:version

get.summary:
Check if any updates are needed for the ARM firwmare or the TI (Bluetooth) firmware.
The "version" string should be in the form of "${ARM_GITHASH}-${ARM_VERSION}-${TI_VERSION}".If the ARM_VERSION is not defined, then use the string "undefined" in its place.
get.description:
Examples of firmware version numbers:
  For the RC 4 firmware release, the version string would be "1b5bfedc-undefined-0.4.2"
  For the RC 5.1 firmware release, the version string would be "788113bb-undefined-0.4.2"
  For the RC 5.6 firmware release, the version string would be "403286da-undefined-1.0.0"
  For the 1.0.55 firmware release, the version string would be "d8df5ada-1.0.55-1.1.12"
  For the 1.0.75 firmware release, the version string would be "f98c98f9-1.0.75-1.1.18"

version.description: Version of the firmware that should be installed on this lock

get.summary:
Gets the firmware update blob for the given chip. Individualizes this firmware update blob if necessary.
The "chip" string should be either "arm" or "ti".
The "version" string should be in the form of "${ARM_GITHASH}-${ARM_VERSION}-${TI_VERSION}".If the ARM_VERSION is not defined, then use the string "undefined" in its place.
Check for firmware updates for a lock version and its chips, which are specified as query parameters
get.description:
Status Codes:
200 OK
404 ResourceNotFound - lockID not found

schema.description: Chip abbreviation, for example `ti`, `sd`, etc. Since different lock versions have different chips, this parameter will be named differently depending on lock version. For example, for L3: sd=1.1.0&dlg=2.0.0

version.description: Version of the firmware that should be installed on this lock

put.summary: This tells the client the lock has firmware supporting the keypad.
put.description: Calling user must be a lock super user.

delete.summary: deletes a house from the system and removes all assocications of that house
delete.description: returns 404 if house not found, 403 if callingUser does not own house

put.summary: Add a user with a type to a house
put.description: Returns 404 if house not found, 403 if callingUser is not superuser of house

put.summary: switch a user of a house between user and superuser
put.description: type is either ['user', 'superuser'].  Returns a 404 if house not found.  Returns 403 if callingUser is not a superuser of the house.  Returns 412 if otherUser is not a user of the house

put.summary: Updates the status of a lock in the locks collection.
put.description: Possible values 'locked,' 'unlocked,' 'unknown,' 'not-advertising.' The end point also publishes status messages and hits web hooks when applicable.

get.summary: Check if there are any version updates available and return a new firmware blob if there is a new version available
get.description: Returns 204 and no body if keypad has proper version.

get.summary: Saves given version as current firmware version in db and returns new version if available.

version.description: Version of the new update firmware (semver).

get.summary: Gets the reset code associate with that particular keypad.
get.description: returns a 404 if the keypad serial number is not found, 403 if it is associated with a lock the user is not a superuser of

put.summary: Stores the resed code of the keypad, the reset code is retained accross lock disassociation
put.description: returns a 404 if the keypad SN is not found, 403 if there is a permission issue, 409 if the resetCode is not valid

get.summary: Creates a handshake key and adds it to given lock's offline keys,
get.description: Calling user must be a lock super user.

post.summary: associate a keypad and a lock and returns the keypad id, the locks collection will be updated to reflect the association

keypadID.description: the identifier of the keypad to use in other request

put.summary: This updates a keypad's currentHandshakeKey.
put.description: Calling user must be a lock super user.

nextHandshakeKey.description: This is the nextHandshakeKey (generated from the same endpoint with a GET request) to replace the currentHandshakeKey.

get.summary: gets a list of apps associated the callingUser
get.description: Response body is an array of connected apps.  If there are no apps, it is an array of length 0.

partnerID.description: ID of partner - maps to `_id` field in GET /partners response

get.summary: retrives a list of service offerings from partners that integrate with August
get.description: Only return partners of type `WORKS_WITH`

post.summary: Create August user/identifiers per given partner user data. Generates access token and (returns) auth code and stores in cache for verification when calling OAuth service.

name.description: String containing both first and last name

auth_code.description: Code for use with OAuth service

put.summary: Gives partners ability to edit partner user's user_id, name and email.
put.description: August user id obtained from access token

name.description: String containing both first and last name

post.summary: follows a specific flow of user identifier verifications, optionally creates a new user, and eventually signs-in the user

value.description: user identifier value, an email address or phone number

code.description: optional verification code for a previously provided identifier

auth_code.description: optional, oAuth authentication code is returned when the flow is completed successfully and indicates a signed-in user

post.summary: Allows a partner to test whether a user with given identifiers exists. Responds with 200 if the user exists, 404 if not
post.description: We chose POST over GET so that we can have the partner provide an encrypted body payload

phone.description: phone number, starting with +, followed by international country code, followed by phone number, numbers only

get.summary: Retrives a list of tags and the partner IDs that have those tags
Get an OAuth URL to use with 3rd party APIs
get.description:
partner information must be in the db and retrievable by partner_id or a 404 is returned.  unexpected platform gives a 4xx response.
state information is tied to the user ID, platform, and partnerID. That value persists for 5 minutes

url.description: string in OAuth 2.0 format:  containts a base url a stringified query args [client_id, redirect_uri, and state]

post.summary: Adds a given email to a partner mailing list.

get.summary: Returns an array of emails of a partner mailing list.
Returns an array of stripped down listing objects with lock associations

locks.description: array of lock IDs associated with this listing

appAccess.description: boolean for do we allow app access for this listing

keypadAccess.description: boolean for do we allow keypad access for this listing

lockID.description: a lock ID that appears in the locks array

put.summary: pairs a lock and listing based on given parameter ids

keypadAccess.description: flag indicating if guests should have access via august keypad

appAccess.description: flag indicating if guests should have access via august app

delete.summary: de-pairs a lock and listing based on given parameter ids

post.summary: associates the specified Airbnb authorization token with the calling user
post.description: creates the association if none exists, updates it if it does exist.

delete.summary: Removes Airbnb credentials for calling user
disconnects August App from app specified by appID for callingUser
delete.description: if callingUser is not associated with the app specified, no error is returned

delete.summary: Delete token for a given app

get.summary: Get or generate a token for a given app
get.description: Current use: The subscription management web UI needs to retrieve some subscriptions related data. We do not want to have that web app access REST API directly. august-subscription-server has been created to provide the required data. To authenticate against august-subscription-server a temporary (30min) token will be used by the web app. The mobile clients will provide that token to the web app after requesting it from REST API.

stores the specifice client serial ID, request time, and response time
post.description: /! DEPRECATED: 410 GoneError

get.summary: Gets status of lock

post.summary: Creates a log entry per given post data; special handling for manual operation. Notifies listeners and issues push notifications to applicable parties.
post.description: /! DEPRECATED: 410 GoneError

delete.summary: Deletes user specified by otherUserID from doorbell specified by doorbellID
delete.description: Returns Unauthorized if the calling user is not a user of the doorbell.Returns Not Found if doorbell or otherUserID do not exist.Returns PreconditionFailed if otherUserID is not a user of the doorbell

delete.summary: Remove all Doorbell Images
delete.description: This will return a 404 if doorbellID does not exist and a NotAuthorizedError if user is not a user of the doorbell

delete.summary: Deletes a connection between a doorbell and a lock
delete.description: This will return a 404 if doorbellID/lockID does not exist and a NotAuthorizedError if user is not a user of the doorbell

put.summary: Creates a connection between a doorbell and a lock
put.description: This will return a 404 if doorbellID/lockID does not exist and a NotAuthorizedError if user is not a user of the doorbell

put.summary: Update Doorbell/User Settings
put.description: Must put the whole settings object.  Cannot update individual field

put.summary: Add doorbell users
put.description: Returns 404 if doorbell is not found.  Returns Not Authorized if calling user is not a user of the doorbell

put.summary: Update Doorbell Settings using presets or custom body with settings
put.description:
Can update individual field 
status code 409 if powerProfilePreset is an invalid preset

powerProfilePreset.description:
[optional] override settings: 
[pirSensitivity, videoResolution, nightModeAlsThreshold, irLedBrightness] with presets.  If passed, must be a valid value. 
The only valid value for this is the integer 0 and -1 (which custom and will be ignored)

get.summary: Gets a temporary viewable URL for archived video
get.description: returns UnauthorizedError if the user is not of that doorbell.  Returns 404 if m3u file is not found.  Returns 401 if no DVR subscription is found.  Returns 404 if video is unavailable in activity log

get.summary: Gets a temporary viewable URL for archived video
get.description: This endpoint is the same (has the same middleware) as GET /doorbells/:doorbellID/videoevent except it uses activitylog Object ID instead of dvrID when querying the database.

get.summary: Gets proxy information for Alexa to view a stream
get.description: returns UnauthorizedError if the user is not of that doorbell.  Endpoint responds in 5 seconds or times out

get.summary: Gets a temporary viewable URL for a downloadable video
get.description: Returns a 202 if no errors are thrown.  Returns UnauthorizedError if the user is not of that doorbell or if the doorbell does not have a DVR subscription.  Returns 404 if the doorbellID or dvrID do not exist.

get.summary: Returns the snapshot associated with a doorbell call
get.description: returns UnauthorizedError if the video does not belong to that doorbell or if the user is not of that doorbell

get.summary: (TEMPORARY)
get.description: does a redirect

post.summary: Adds a doorbell to a house.
post.description: the pin returned might be different than the one requested if it was already used.

doorbellID.description: unique ID of doorbell, the client will use this ID for all subsequent transactions

post.summary: Shares a DVR Video With August Marketing
post.description: Returns 404 if HLS video stream is unavailable

post.summary: Application hits this endpoint when they want to join, leave, or heartbeat for an AV Session related to a doorbell press or IR sensor.
post.description: Valid actions are ['heartbeat' 'join', 'leave', 'status'].Only 1 user is allowed to respond to the doorbell press.  Otherwise a ConflictError (409) is sent back.When a user responds a pubnub message is sent to the other listeners to disable their response capability on the client.In the event that this API is not called with a hangup or heartbeat (client power or connection failure) the call will be ended when the key expiresWhen a call is hung up, an object called callStats is expected in the request body.videoAvailable flag is only present for 'respond'

<userID1>.description: array of objects.  objects are keyed by action (join or leave) and value is a number of when they did it

initiated_user.description: string if a user started the call

answered_user.description: string if a call was started by the doorbell

image.description: object if image has been uploaded already

<userID1>.description: array of objects.  objects are keyed by action (join or leave) and value is a number of when they did it

initiated_user.description: string if a user started the call

answered_user.description: string if a call was started by the doorbell

image.description: object if image has been uploaded already

<userID1>.description: array of objects.  objects are keyed by action (join or leave) and value is a number of when they did it

initiated_user.description: string if a user started the call

answered_user.description: string if a call was started by the doorbell

image.description: object if image has been uploaded already

<userID1>.description: array of objects.  objects are keyed by action (join or leave) and value is a number of when they did it

initiated_user.description: string if a user started the call

answered_user.description: string if a call was started by the doorbell

image.description: object if image has been uploaded already

post.summary: Generates a pubnub message when a doorbell is pressed or motion is detected.  An image is taken from the camera and sent in another pubnub message to the doorbell user
post.description: THIS FUNCTION WAS MOVED TO THE MARS API SERVER.  POSTing to /doorbells/:doorbellID/event/:eventType will upload the image taken from the camera in the body and send the url of the image in the pubnub message image for the other user.  eventType is either 'presence' or 'buttonpush'.  doorbellID is also required in params

put.summary: adds a user to a doorbell
put.description: If the doorbell or other user doesn't exist return ResourceNotFound error.  If calling user is not a user of the doorbell return NotAuthorizedError

put.summary: Publishes a message so the doorbell knows to reboot
put.description: If the doorbell or other user doesn't exist return ResourceNotFound error.  If calling user is not a user of the doorbell return NotAuthorizedError

put.summary: Publishes a message so the doorbell knows to wakeup
put.description: If the doorbell or other user doesn't exist return ResourceNotFound error.  If calling user is not a user of the doorbell return NotAuthorizedError

post.summary: Writes to the logs
post.description: If the doorbell or other user doesn't exist return ResourceNotFound error.If calling user is not a user of the doorbell return NotAuthorizedError.Takes an array of log objects or a log object in the body of the request.

post.summary: Creates an unverified user for a given pin and lock
post.description: if the pin is already used this request will fail and return a 409

lockID.description: the lock this user is associated with

pin.description: the pin requested for this user

id.description: the id of the unverified user

firstName.description: the firstName passed as a param

put.summary: Updates an unverified user associated with a lock

lockID.description: the id of the lock associated with the unverified user

firstName.description: the first name of the unverified user to update

lastName.description: the last name of the unverified user to update

delete.summary: deletes a reserved pin
delete.description: the call will be successful, if the pin had already been expired or doesn't exists

get.summary: Returns homekit key for given lock and calling user.
get.description: /! DEPRECATED: 410 GoneError

put.summary: Creates or change the pin on the specified lock for the specified user
put.description: created: means that the PIN should be loaded onto the lock, first step of associating a pin loaded: means that the PIN has been loaded to the lock, second and final step of associating a pin deleting: means that the PIN should be deleted, first step of removing a pin from a lock deleted: means that the PIN has been be deleted from the lock disabling: means the the PIN should be disabled disabled: means that the PIN has been marked as disabled on the lock enabling: means that the PIN should be enabled enabled: means that the PIN has been enabled, which means that it is back in the loaed group of PINs. The PIN is only necessary when creating it

state.description: the state of the pin, which can be 'created','loaded','deleted','disabling','disabled'

firstName.description: the firstName of the user, optional

lastName.description: the lastName of the user, optional

accessType.description: string: the type of the pin: always, recurring, temporary, oneTime

accessTimes.description: string: this field only required for access types recurring & temporary; for recurring access type possible values are "STARTSEC=<sec from start of day>[;ENDSEC=<sec from start of day>]"; if timezone of lock is known this is also valid: "DTSTART=<ISO date in UTC>[;DTEND=<ISO date in UTC>]" (end date optional, if not provided is set to 1 hour from start date). For temporary times must be ISO date in UTC. Not required when schedule is provided.

accessRecurrence.description: string: only required for access type recurring. See recurrence rules under RFC2445, e.g.: "FREQ=MONTHLY;BYMONTHDAY=10,15;COUNT=20". Not required when schedule is provided.

schedule.description: string: iCal data format following RFC5545 (https://tools.ietf.org/html/rfc5545) required for access types recurring & temporary; when accessTimes & accessRecurrence are provided, data of schedule overrides their values.

put.summary: Creates or change the pin/rf/finger on the specified lock for the specified user
put.description: created: means that the PIN should be loaded onto the lock, first step of associating a pin loaded: means that the PIN has been loaded to the lock, second and final step of associating a pin deleting: means that the PIN should be deleted, first step of removing a pin from a lock deleted: means that the PIN has been be deleted from the lock disabling: means the the PIN should be disabled disabled: means that the PIN has been marked as disabled on the lock enabling: means that the PIN should be enabled enabled: means that the PIN has been enabled, which means that it is back in the loaed group of PINs. The 'pin' is only necessary when type euqals pin & create it. this is going to replace 'PUT /locks/:lockID/users/:otherUserID/pin'

action.description: the action of operation, which can be 'intent', 'commit'

state.description: the state of the pin/rf/finger, which can be 'load','enable','disable','delate','update'

accessType.description: string: the type of the pin/rf/finger: 'always', 'recurring', 'temporary', 'oneTime', the default value is 'always'

accessTimes.description: string: this field only required for access types recurring & temporary; for recurring access type possible values are "STARTSEC=<sec from start of day>[;ENDSEC=<sec from start of day>]"; if timezone of lock is known this is also valid: "DTSTART=<ISO date in UTC>[;DTEND=<ISO date in UTC>]" (end date optional, if not provided is set to 1 hour from start date). For temporary times must be ISO date in UTC. Not required when schedule is provided.

accessRecurrence.description: string: only required for access type recurring. See recurrence rules under RFC2445, e.g.: "FREQ=MONTHLY;BYMONTHDAY=10,15;COUNT=20". Not required when schedule is provided.

schedule.description: string: iCal data format following RFC5545 (https://tools.ietf.org/html/rfc5545) required for access types recurring & temporary; when accessTimes & accessRecurrence are provided, data of schedule overrides their values.

created.description: array of the unique lock & user which state is created

loaded.description: array of the unique lock & user which state is loaded

disabled.description: array of the unique lock & user which state is disabled

disabling.description: array of the unique lock & user which state is disabling

enabling.description: array of the unique lock & user which state is enabling

deleting.description: array of the unique lock & user which state is deleting

updating.description: array of the unique lock & user which state is updating

put.summary: Inform server of time adjustment for a lock
put.description: When a mobile device detects the clock on the lock is out of sync, it sets the time and informs the server of the adjustment.  Returns authorization error if callingUser is not able to use lock.  Returns success otherwise.

get.summary: returns all nest cameras that can be associated with a lock

delete.description: Does not disassociate the camera from the house

post.summary: Sends sdp offer by proxying pubnub messages to the doorbell and awaits an sdp answer on that pubnub channel.  That sdp answer is returned to the caller.
post.description:
Error Codes:
403 NotAuthorized - user is not authorized to access doorbell
404 ResourceNotFound - doorbellID not found
408 RequestTimeoutError - Doorbell cannot wakeup || receives incorrectly formatted sdp offer || doorbell is not listening on the pubnub channel message was published to || doorbell is offline and has not yet been reported by server (15 minute window)
409 ConflictError - doorbell has firmware that does not support webrtc || has not set the "caps" property with "webrtc"
409 MissingParameter - missing body parameter "offer" or "clientTransactionID"
422 UnprocessableEntityError - doorbell status is offline
500 InternalServerError - other internal server error

timeoutMs.description: milliseconds to wait for a pubnub response, 30000 max, 5000 default

offer.description:
sdp offer string with "
" newline delimeters

clientTransactionID.description: identifier sent by the client to trace transaction

put.summary: Wake a tcp connected device
put.description:
Status Codes:
200 OK - Device already online
202 Accepted - Doorbell was in standby mode and is being woken up
404 ResourceNotFound - doorbellID not found
412 Precondition Failed - device not connected to tcp keep alive server || device is offline ||
Doorbell does not support tcp keep alive || wakeup token not set || invalid doorbell status
500 InternalServerError - other internal server error

delete.summary: Delete a user account.  The userID must match the one in the access token.
delete.description:
Status Codes:
401 InvalidCredentialsError
  - The userID does not match the one in the access token.
  - The access token is invalid.
  - The user is blacklisted.

get.summary: Get brand and locale specific URLs
get.description:
Status Codes:
301 - Success/redirect to URL400 - Invalid brand404 - Link not found

post.summary: Add user to orchestra. The user is then linked and has a new property `orchestraCustomerId`
post.description:
Error Codes:
412 PreconditionFailedError - user already linked to orchestra
500 InternalServerError - other internal server error

delete.summary: Remove user to orchestra.  The userID must match the one in the access token.
delete.description:
Status Codes:
401 InvalidCredentialsError
  - The userID does not match the one in the access token.
  - The access token is invalid.
  - The user is blacklisted.
412 PreconditionFailedError - user not linked to orchestra

get.summary: Get user accesses and credentials to orchestra
get.description:
Status Codes:
401 InvalidCredentialsError
  - The userID does not match the one in the access token.
  - The access token is invalid.
  - The user is blacklisted.
412 PreconditionFailedError - user not linked to orchestra

put.summary: Update access to orchestra
put.description:
Status Codes:
400 BadRequestError - params and body do not match schema
401 InvalidCredentialsError
  - The userID does not match the one in the access token.
  - The access token is invalid.
  - The user is blacklisted.
403 PreconditionFailedError - user does not owns access
404 ResourceNotFoundError - access not found

granted.description: boolean to respond to an access request

lockID.description: lockID associated with the access request. Required if granted is true.

delete.summary: Delete access to orchestra with it's credentials
delete.description:
Status Codes:
400 BadRequestError - params do not match schema
401 InvalidCredentialsError
  - The userID does not match the one in the access token.
  - The access token is invalid.
  - The user is blacklisted.
403 PreconditionFailedError - user does not owns access
404 ResourceNotFoundError - access not found

delete.summary: Delete credential to orchestra
delete.description:
Status Codes:
400 BadRequestError - params do not match schema
401 InvalidCredentialsError
  - The userID does not match the one in the access token.
  - The access token is invalid.
  - The user is blacklisted.
403 NotAuthorizedError
  - user does not owns access
  - credential does not belongs to the access
404 ResourceNotFoundError
  - access not found
  - credential not found
